history.content:
I wouldn't underestimate 186. It's a decent class and the workload is one of the lightest among all the CS upperdivs I've taken but CS170 takes a lot of time for some people and I've heard 161 is an average workload as well. I'm sure work will come in waves but since 186 and 161 are project base courses I foresee weeks where you're stuck on projects and a 170 problem set and that would be quite awful. If you're in no hurry, I wouldn't take all 3 at once.

------

I'm taking 186 right now and it's one of the lightest classes I've ever taken in terms of workload. There are weekly quizzes which take about 10-20 minutes to do if you're caught up with the material, and 5 coding assignments. The coding assignments so far have been pretty light, all under 60 lines of code written, and you can do them with partners. I would put it on about the same level as 188.

I wouldn't underestimate 186. It's a decent class and the workload is one of the lightest among all the CS upperdivs I've taken but CS170 takes a lot of time for some people and I've heard 161 is an average workload as well. I'm sure work will come in waves but since 186 and 161 are project base courses I foresee weeks where you're stuck on projects and a 170 problem set and that would be quite awful. If you're in no hurry, I wouldn't take all 3 at once.

------

I'm sure work will come in waves but since 186 and 161 are project base courses I foresee weeks where you're stuck on projects and a 170 problem set and that would be quite awful. If you're in no hurry, I wouldn't take all 3 at once.

What is the workload like for CS 186? Would it be ok to take with CS 170 and possibly CS 161?

I'm a L&S CS sophomore currently taking CS 61C and 70 + a breadth and my workload right now is decent.
history.subject: CS 186 Workload
